post.description:
The method is used to add a new or update an existing contact. The ID field is ignored.
To learn more about importing or updating contacts and their additional fields, read Importing historical data.

firstName.description:
Contact’s first name. The following rules apply to character usage:
- Max length: 40 symbols.
- Letters from any alphabet are allowed (Unicode characters).
- Three words longer than 3 characters and three words with a maximum of 3 characters are allowed.
- Up to 3 digits are allowed.
- Special characters are not allowed, except for:
-- Apostrophes ''ʼ`´ʹʻʽʾʿˈˊˮʹ΄՚᾽᾿'‛′‵Ꞌꞌ＇ (only inside words)
-- Hyphen - (only inside words)
-- One dot at the end of words having max 3 characters. Example: Jr.
- Names consisting only of numbers and special characters are not allowed

post.description:
The method is used for the integration of subscription forms.
If a contact does not exist, it is created with the non-confirmed email.
If a contact exists, the contact fields are updated (except existing media channels).
New contacts are created with a not confirmed status.

schema.description:
The method for double opt-in implementation. A created contact is unconfirmed.
It is impossible to send bulk emails to such contacts until they confirm their subscription; however, they are available for receiving important trigger messages.
An event will be automatically generated after this method is called.
Sending a confirmation email can be implemented using the mechanism of events and campaigns.
When clicking the link in the letter, a contact becomes confirmed and available for bulk emails sending.

get.description:
Search for contacts. The method returns max 500 results.
The total amount of contacts is in the TotalCount header.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The number of the first contact returned in the search results.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Possible value is 'contactId'. Only actual for searches without conditions. By default, the date of contact update is used for the search.
If this parameter is used, sorting is done by contactId. Using this parameter allows you to upload contacts faster.

channels.description:
List of media channels.
You can add maximum two channels of the same type. It is necessary to specify at least one channel.

get.description: The method is used for getting the status of the contact import session by the asynchronous ID of the session.

status.description:
STARTED - import session in queue for processing.
IMPORTING - import session being processed at the moment.
FINISHED - import session completed successfully.
ERROR - error when processing import session.

timestamp.description: The status setting time in the ISO 8601 format.

mapping.description:
The list of contact IDs created/updated as a result of the import.
An array of "key" - "value" pairs, where the key is a contact field used to determine uniqueness, and the value is the contact ID.

dedupeValue.description: A value of the field used to determine the contact uniqueness.

items.description:
The list of contact IDs created/updated as a result of the import.
An array of "key" - "value" pairs, where the key is a contact field used to determine uniqueness, and the value is the contact ID.

The method is used to search for email messages using a part of their name or a tag.
The method returns 500 messages maximum.
The TotalCount header contains the number of messages returned to the query.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search condition (a part of the message name or a tag)

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description:
The index of the first message to return from the search result.
Numbering starts at 1

parameters.name: maxrows
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return (max. 500).

post.description: The method is used for adding/updating the language version of a message identified by the internal ID (for multilingual messages).

get.description: The method is used for getting a link to view the email message.

post.description:
The method is used for sending a prepared message to one or many contacts. You can create broadcasts for Email, SMS, Mobile Push, Web Push, Viber, Telegram Bot channels.
You can parametrize the message for each contact individually.

contactId.description: Required parameter, if "locator" and "externalCustomerId" are not specified.

externalCustomerId.description: Required parameter, if "locator" and "contactId" are not specified.

locator.description:
Recipient's media-channel. Required parameter, if "contactId" and "externalCustomerId" are not specified.
For example: email-address for email messages; phone number for SMS or Viber; token for Web or Mob-push messages; chat_id for Telegram bot.

jsonParam.description: The set of parameters in JSON format. Used for the messages with the dynamic content.

languageCode.description: Desired message language for the contact. Used for the multilingual messages.

email.description:
Message type.
true for email, false for other media-channels.

fromName.description:
Sender name.
For email, indicate the sender name only, without an email address. The sender's email address selected in the message is used.
For SMS, use the alphanumeric sender ID.

status.description:
Email:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
UNDELIVERED: Message is not delivered.
BLACKLISTED: Email is in blacklist.
NOT_CONFIRMED: Email is not confirmed.
UNSUBSCRIBED: Unsubscribed email.
SPAM: Email is reported as spam.
READ: Message was read.
CLICKED: Contact clicked the links in the message.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.

ERROR: SMTP/ESMTP or other sending error.

SMS:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
PENDING: Message was sent, but delivery confirmation has not been received yet.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
SMS_UNDELIVERED_STATE: Message is not delivered.
EXPIRED: Message status waiting time is over.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.

Viber:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
PENDING: Message was sent, but delivery confirmation has not been received yet.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
READ: Message is read.
CLICKED: Contact clicked the links in the message.
VIBER_UNKNOWN_USER: Viber application is not installed on the mobile device.
VIBER_UNDELIVERED_STATE: Message is not delivered.
VIBER_EXPIRED_STATE: Message status waiting time is over.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.
Telegram:

DELIVERED: The message is delivered.
BOT_SEND_ERROR: The message is not delivered because the recipient has blocked it or the chat was not found.
CLICKED: The recipient followed the link in the message.

The method is used for generating events in the account to be used for starting a workflow or being taken into account for segmentation.
Max. size of content for events sent in the request body is 20 kB.
To learn more, read Order management via events.

eventTypeKey.description:
Event type ID key. If no event type exists with this key, a new event is created.
All characters are allowed except < ; ’ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 100 symbols

keyValue.description:
Event key. Determines event uniqueness.
The key must contain a unique value for each contact (for example, email, phone number, external contact id, etc.)
If this parameter is not set, params must contain one of the following contact identifiers:
- contactId
- externalCustomerId
- email
- phone
- pushToken: web or mobile
All characters are allowed except the following ones < ; ’ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 300 symbols

Used in campaigns and for creating dynamic content in messages.

firstName.description:
Contact’s first name. The following rules apply to character usage:
- Max length: 40 symbols.
- Letters from any alphabet are allowed (Unicode characters).
- Three words longer than 3 characters and three words with a maximum of 3 characters are allowed.
- Up to 3 digits are allowed.
- Special characters are not allowed, except for:
-- Apostrophes ''ʼ`´ʹʻʽʾʿˈˊˮʹ΄՚᾽᾿'‛′‵Ꞌꞌ＇ (only inside words)
-- Hyphen - (only inside words)
-- One dot at the end of words having max 3 characters. Example: Jr.
- Names consisting only of numbers and special characters are not allowed

status.description:
Email:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
UNDELIVERED: Message is not delivered.
BLACKLISTED: Email is in blacklist.
NOT_CONFIRMED: Email is not confirmed.
UNSUBSCRIBED: Unsubscribed email.
SPAM: Email is reported as spam.
READ: Message was read.
CLICKED: Contact clicked the links in the message.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.

ERROR: SMTP/ESMTP or other sending error.

SMS:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
PENDING: Message was sent, but delivery confirmation has not been received yet.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
SMS_UNDELIVERED_STATE: Message is not delivered.
EXPIRED: Message status waiting time is over.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.

Viber:

IN_QUEUE: Message is in queue for sending.
PENDING: Message was sent, but delivery confirmation has not been received yet.
DELIVERED: Message is delivered.
READ: Message is read.
CLICKED: Contact clicked the links in the message.
VIBER_UNKNOWN_USER: Viber application is not installed on the mobile device.
VIBER_UNDELIVERED_STATE: Message is not delivered.
VIBER_EXPIRED_STATE: Message status waiting time is over.
NO_MONEY: Insufficient funds for sending.
Telegram:

DELIVERED: The message is delivered.
BOT_SEND_ERROR: The message is not delivered because the recipient has blocked it or the chat was not found.
CLICKED: The recipient followed the link in the message.

locator.description:
Recipient's media-channel. Required parameter, if "contactId" and "externalCustomerId" are not specified.
For example: email-address for email messages; phone number for SMS or Viber; token for Web or Mob-push messages; chat_id for Telegram bot.

fromName.description:
Sender name.
For email, indicate the sender name only, without an email address. The sender's email address selected in the message is used.
For SMS, use the alphanumeric sender ID.
If the parameter is not indicated, the sender name selected in the message is used.

status.description:
ACCEPTED - the event added successfully to processing.
OCCURRED_DATE_IS_REQUIRED - no event occurrence date present.
INCORRECT_OCCURRED_DATE_FORMAT - incorrect date format.
OCCURRED_TIME_TOO_DEPTH - the event occurrence time is beyond the limit for the past.
OCCURRED_TIME_IN_FUTURE - the event occurrence time cannot be in the future.
EVENT_SEGMENTATION_DISABLED - the segmentation for this event is disabled. More info at How to use event segmentation
SERVER_ERROR - failure to put the message in the queue for sending.

firstName.description:
Contact’s first name. The following rules apply to character usage:
- Max length: 40 symbols.
- Letters from any alphabet are allowed (Unicode characters).
- Three words longer than 3 characters and three words with a maximum of 3 characters are allowed.
- Up to 3 digits are allowed.
- Special characters are not allowed, except for:
-- Apostrophes ''ʼ`´ʹʻʽʾʿˈˊˮʹ΄՚᾽᾿'‛′‵Ꞌꞌ＇ (only inside words)
-- Hyphen - (only inside words)
-- One dot at the end of words having max 3 characters. Example: Jr.
- Names consisting only of numbers and special characters are not allowed

lastName.description:
Contact’s last name. The following rules apply to character usage:
- Max length: 40 symbols.
- Letters from any alphabet are allowed (Unicode characters).
- Three words longer than 3 characters and three words with a maximum of 3 characters are allowed.
- Up to 3 digits are allowed.
- Special characters are not allowed, except for:
-- Apostrophes ''ʼ`´ʹʻʽʾʿˈˊˮʹ΄՚᾽᾿'‛′‵Ꞌꞌ＇ (only inside words)
-- Hyphen - (only inside words)
-- One dot at the end of words having max 3 characters. Example: Jr.
- Names consisting only of numbers and special characters are not allowed

SubscribeContact.description:
The method for double opt-in implementation. A created contact is unconfirmed.
It is impossible to send bulk emails to such contacts until they confirm their subscription; however, they are available for receiving important trigger messages.
An event will be automatically generated after this method is called.
Sending a confirmation email can be implemented using the mechanism of events and campaigns.
When clicking the link in the letter, a contact becomes confirmed and available for bulk emails sending.

activityStatus.description:
Activity status

DELIVERED - message delivered
UNDELIVERED - message not delivered
READ - message read
UNSUBSCRIBED - contact unsubscribed from mailing
SUBSCRIPTION_CHANGED - contact changed subscription categories
CLICKED - contact followed the links in the message
SPAM - contact complained about spam

statusDescription.description:
This field is returned only if the status is UNDELIVERED,
Contains the cause of the delivery failure.
This may be a response from the recipient's server, a system's response about inability to send the message, etc.

eventTypeKey.description:
Event type ID key. If no such event type exists with such a key, a new one is created.
All characters are allowed except < ; ’ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 100 symbols

keyValue.description:
Event key. Determines event uniqueness.
The key must contain a unique value for each contact (for example, email, phone number, external contact id, etc.)
If this parameter is not set, params must contain one of the following contact identifiers:
- contactId
- externalCustomerId
- email
- phone
- pushToken: web or mobile
All characters are allowed except < ; ’ \ / | " ` ' ^ ? ! , >
Max length: 300 symbols
